tagDescription: Informing him that the repeal of the Embargo Bill and other matters passed the Senate

tagDescription: Has instructed commanding engineer to repair the barracks at York.

tagDescription: Regarding petition for a bridge at Dufferin Creek.

tagDescription: Acknowledges letter of Feb.20. Agrees that co-operation of Indians depends on support of regular troops. Has ordered construction of a new ship at Amherstburgh.

tagDescription: Report on cases of five settlers on Dundas St. in Toronto.

tagDescription: State they have inspected the secretary and registrar's offices. Transmit papers in connection with them.

tagDescription: Requests authority to answer Hepburn's six queries.

tagDescription: Regarding affairs in the American government. Common report holds threat of immediate war with England.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: P. Selby to same. Reports that an irregular deed to James McDowall is stayed in Auditor General's office.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Erroneous patents for Francis Clark and Conradt England have been lodged by Jarvis in attorney general's office.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Report on the petition of Richard Hatt for lots in Coote's Paradise.
Returns order for crosscut saw for correction.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Stating that it is not expedient to erect a powder magazine at York.
Wm. Chewett to the same. Transmits letter from Mahlon Burwell regarding the difficulty of executing instructions in the survey of Yarmouth Township.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: John McGill to same. Announcing his arrival at Kingston. Gives shipping news: The Toronto is leaking
cannot sail for lack of hands. Col. Stone has announced the death of his son, Wm. M. Stone, collector at Gananoque.
Explains terms of lease recommended by the Council.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Respecting the Humber River ferry.
Reports conduct of Lieut. Portier in breaking open letter box at head of the Lake.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Attached: Power of attorney from D. Killine to D. McGuin, tavernkeeper, New York, 4 July 1783.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: (3) Estimate of ordnance ammunition and stores for the corvette building at Amherstburgh.
Requests approval of instructions to M. Burwell who sails following day.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Enclosed: (2) Memo of fifteen lots in Township of Murray applied for.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Joseph Edwards to same. Requests information on land at Sixteen Mile Creek containing salt springs.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Forwards Treasury letter for John McGill.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Will recommend his reappointment to the Legislative Council on his becoming a permanent resident. His seat forfeited through absence in a foreign country without leave.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Regarding his seat in the Legislative Council.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Warrant for admission of William Claus as a member of the Legislative Council, U.C.
Gives names of settlers on Dundas St. who have failed to perform duty on road to River Credit.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Requests permission to cut firewood on Wolfe Island.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Inventory of government property in the registrar's office, by Wm. Jarvis.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Same to the same. Directs issue of fiat for commission appointing Wm. Willcocks and Wm. W. Baldwin, judges, Howe district court.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Directs prosecution of McDonall and Reuben Beagle, of Ernestown, for performing marriages illegally.
Enclosed: Extract of a letter Washington, 4 January 1809, Gives his views to action of American government if restrictions continue on neutral commerce.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: appointing him Adjutant-in the 5th Regt., Lincoln militia.
Report on the petition of Alex. Summers
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Petition of Abraham McDonald to be excused doing the settling duties on a lot in Whitechurch.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout to same. Report on Capt. Mathew Elliott's petition for Capt. Thomas McKee's location.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Authority given Gore to retain John McGill in office, approved.
Authorizes completion of the Dover and Chatham surveys, with due regard to Crown and clergy reserves.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809

tagDescription: Sworn statement of Thomas Scruton, agent for Messrs. Moore and Joliffe of Quebec, regarding cutting of masts.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Report that lots in Lancaster petitioned for by David Munto and the Widow McLeod are vacant.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Charles Stuart, sheriff, to same. Regarding seizure of about 60,000 staves on Wolfe Island. Sale of these staves to commence 22 May 1809.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Col. Henry Procter to same. Reports death of Capt. Cowan and regrets lack of medical skill at Fort Erie.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Stating that he has visited Wolfe Island and seized and marked all Crown timber.
Thornton to same. Leave of absence cannot be granted to Lieut. Crowther. In the present unsettled state of the country leave cannot be granted to Lt.-Col. Procter.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Regarding proceedings in the suit against David M. Rogers to be stayed until further notice.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Report by Capt. Wm. Derenzy of repairs required at St. Josephs.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Acknowledges appointment as commissioner of roads, Johnstown district.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Returns certificate for salary.
Introduces Col. Bernard, inspecting field officer, hitherto detained by illness.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: P. Selby to same. Has received orders of 6 June, 1801 and 1 January, 1803.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Explains a deed to Mary Smith, or Weaver.
Transmits list of reserved lots in the Township of Murray.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Testimonial from Robert Kerr and J. Muirhead, justices that John Gough, shopkeeper, has been a resident of Niagara and sold goods from house to house.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Requests leave of absence.
Despatches have been forwarded.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Reports forwarding letters to New York. Expresses thanks for permission to locate Mrs. Crook's land in good situation.
Transmits estimate of pine timber required for use of the Marine Dept. at Amherstburgh.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Authority for S. Wilmot to complete the survey of Camden and Portland townships.
Protest against Returning Officer for the west Riding of York.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Report on land grants to John Hill. Memo on John Hill's title to certain grants.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Same to the same. Informing him of an error in the deed for James McDowall.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Rev. John Strachan to same. Regarding Captain Anderson's half-pay.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Enclosed: Charlotteville, 12 December, 1808, Requests authority to correct concession lines run by Mr. Hambly.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Report on lots in Crowland for James McAlpien.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Same to the same. Has erased names from commissions of Oyer and Terminer.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: to Dept. of State, 29 June 1808 Regarding boats seized by the customs at Niagara

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: Representation of magistrates of the Niagara district, Niagara, June 5, 1809, respecting a fine of 210 each imposed on seven persons for an assault and false imprisonment of Z. Harvey, citizen of the U.S. Fine considered unjust.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Regarding expenses to be borne by military chest.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Objects to altering warrant to correct a mistake.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Regarding pay for ship carpenters for Amherstburgh.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Reports the death of Capt. Cowan and solicits promotion.
tagPerson: Gauvrau, F., 2nd Lieut. and mate of the Camden

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Will Ross, commissary, to same. Has forwarded all stationery on hand.

tagPerson: Warren, E., commander of the forces
tagDescription: Acknowledges quarterly pay lists. No repairs have been made on the Toronto. Pitch is unobtainable, but has purchased some resin.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Recommends five families from New Brunswick, under the leadership of Thomas Marygold, for land.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Report on vacant lots in Hamilton township.
Lt.-Col. Ed. Baynes to same. Authorizes extension of leave to Lt. D. Campbell, fort major at Fort George.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Report of a survey on the Humber River made by William Hambly, January 1798. Copy made by Chewett and Ridout.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Transmits copy of a letter from Rev. Edward Drewe, chaplain, to the Secretary at War, applying for pay due.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Estimate of the expense of building a smith's shop at Fort George.
Richard Hatt to the same. Protest against the Returning Officer, west Riding of York.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Hon. R. Hamilton to same. Will attend as a member of the Leg. Council.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) Estimate of expenses of workmanship and materials for building a corvette of 16 guns, Amherstburgh, May 22, 1809.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Affidavit of James Russell, master carpenter, that his income is derived from his pay and allowances.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Personal letter.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Recommends Jonathan Jones for position of clerk of the Johnstown district court.
Report on land for children of the late Capt. Brant. Grants of 200 acres each to Jacob and Joseph Brant.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Applies for return of patent fee paid by Mordecai Sales, agent for Benjamin Rogers, as requested by John Small.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Commodore Alex. Grant to same. Regarding promotions following Capt. Cowan's death.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Remarks on American activities. Regular force at Detroit numbers 210 rank and file, with 600 militia. Weak state of posts has estranged the Indians.
Regarding deeds for her late father, Nicholas Hoffman.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Same to the same. Acknowledges receipt of a separate letter of 27 January.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Statement of provisions required to complete supplies for the troops, Indians, etc., from 1 October, 1809 to 1 October, 1810.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Report on lots for Thomas Merigold.
Enclosed: Letter from Rev. Alex. McDonell, York, 5 April 1809, to Wm. Chewett. Forwards schedule of deeds issued by himself.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Acknowledges order to summon members of Council to meet 2 February 1809.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Wm. Jarvis to same. Advising him that Thomas Mears has been chosen member for Prescott county.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Reports Duncan McDonell suitable as a licensed surveyor.
Informing him that copies of proceedings of Ex. Council on land matters are completed to 8 October, 1808.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: In explanation of accounts wanting.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Wm. Jarvis reports on auditor general's remarks on patents for land, supposed by him as not accounted for, signed by H.E. Lt.-Gov. Gore, under regulations of 1796.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Reports his arrival at Kingston with instructions to examine naval force on Lake Ontario.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Reports arrangement with U.S. government to repeal Orders in Council and to renew intercourse on 10 June 1809.
Acknowledges copies of the Laws of 1808.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Enclosed: (2) Letter Fort George, 20 December, 1808, regarding Lieut. Crowther.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Advising him to postpone building a new vessel at Amherstburg.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout to the same. Report on lot for John Drummond Smith in Cramahe. The lot is vacant through default of improvement by John Turner in 1797.
Concerning Indian stores shipped on the William.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: A friend of the British Constitution to Gore. Complains of seizure, on the British side, by four armed men, of three American deserters.
Accepts his offer to forward despatches.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Employment of detachment of men of 41st Regt. approved. To work on lighthouse on Gibraltar Point
John McGill to same. Report on saws remaining in the stores.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Advises placing militia at Kingston for the protection of the dockyard. Proclamation should be printed to the effect that pardons for deserters is extended to April 24.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Requests information as to inspection of goods received from England by the Three Brothers.
Report on lots in Crowland petitioned for by John McDonell.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: S. Anderson to same. States that he will resign his civil appointment if it interferes with his half-pay.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: D. Continuation of above.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Requests explanation of increase of allowances to James Givins, Indian interpreter.
Wm. Jarvis to same. Thomas Mears is sworn in and takes his seat as member for Prescott county.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Transmits a memorial from the Indians of Sault St. Louis, claiming part of the seigniory of La Prairie, with plan of the seigniory survey of 1769. Directs that Indians be assembled and informed that boundaries so formally established cannot be changed. [Memorial not at this place.]

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: John McGill to same. Reports the store at Gibraltar Point having been broken into and articles stolen.
Encloses copy of a letter from Col. Glasgow, 6 March, 1809. Requests orders for the removal of carriages and carronades. Starts for headquarters in the morning. Corvette to be afloat in June.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Reports that some ship carpenters will go to Amherstburgh at 716 per day, with rations.
Alex. Stuart, barrister, to the same. Requests Court of Appeal be assembled to hear cause of Haun and Warren.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809

tagDescription: Requests him to disregard Taylor's application for land at present.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Alex. Wood to the same. Applies for grant of money as commissioner of roads, Eastern district.
Capt. N. Mackenzie to the same. Reports departure of the Duke of Gloucester from Kingston.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Herman Ryland to same. Acknowledges receipt of U.C. Laws for 1808 and 1809. Requests complete sets of U.C. Statutes for public offices.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) Memorial of Lieut. Crowther, York, 10 December, 1808, applying for active service.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Report on the petition of Daniel McLeod. Cannot find any location or order for land in the name of the petitioner.
Samuel Ridout and Andrew Mercer to same. Request permission to erect a distillery near York.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: (5) Amherstburgh, 24 May, 1809, Agrees to furnish tarred cordage to H.M. vessels on Lakes Erie and Huron.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Report on Lot No. 59 in n Marysburgh for David Brown.
Memo by Wm. Chewett. A reserve for a canal in Murray township was made under Governor Simcoe, 19 July 1796.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Authorizes draft for proclamation adding the name of Thomas Talbot as a commissioner to purchase hemp.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Complains of not having his regular tour of command. A junior officer, Capt. Muir, having been sent to Port Erie in command.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Lt.-Col. J. Grant to same. Regarding applicants for 12 vacant lots in Amherstburgh. Will direct engineer to lay out another street in Malden.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Transmits letter from Major Fuller regarding the skiff for the use of the guard at Gibraltar Point.
Thomas Ridout to same. Acknowledges 250 copies of the Laws for 1808, and 500 copies for 1809.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Thomas Reynolds, commissary, to same. Transmits accounts for beef and stores. [Account missing]
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: Letter York, 23 March 1809, Will attend survey for Col. Talbot, but doubts that he can hire men at price allowed by Government.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Explanation of his conduct in appointing a deputy. Submits Thomas Hamilton's name as his deputy.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Requests reply to his petition for grant of islands in the Niagara, opposite Bridgewater Mills, for erection of similar mills.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Transmits communication from D.M. Erskine, Washington. Advises him that only the Canada and the General Hunter are fit to meet new vessels building at Oswego by the Americans. Points out probable places of invasion.
Introduces John Harwick and his son, Hessian loyalists, recommending them for grants of land.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Enclosed: Capt. John Caddy, Amherstburgh, 29 January 1809, to Col. Shaw. Gives estimate of timber required.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Requests return of circuit commissions.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Application for rigging.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: John McGill to same. Regarding necessary repairs to the storehouse at Gibraltar Point.
Enclosed: Montreal, 3 July 1809, Informs him that the 100th Regt. will relieve the 41st in U.C. Directs the Camden and General Hunter be despatched to Fort Erie to transport troops.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Transmits letter from Capt. Caddy at Amherstburgh, and asks his opinion. [Letter not at this place].
Explains two full fees due the Lt.-Gov. under the Regulation of 1796.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Report on lot of land petitioned for by Thomas B. Gough, in York township.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout to same. Report on lots in Coote's Paradise for Richard and Samuel Hatt.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout's copy of letter York, 20 November 1797, Regarding a lot for Dennis, shipbuilder.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Authority to prepare necessary papers to administer oath to members of Council and Assembly.
Transmits letter and schedule of land grants from Rev. Alex. McDonell.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout to same. Report on William Cooper's application for land in Trafalgar.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Enclosed: Samuel Sherwood, Augusta, 6 May 1809. Refuses commission as Captain in the militia which he returns. [Commission not at this place.]
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Sub-enclosure: Schedule of deeds.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Transmits a return of ordnance, etc., required for Marine service on Lake Erie. Discusses disposal of ordnance.
Memo regarding despatches forwarded by Lt. Col. Thornton, military secretary.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Unable to obtain books from predecessor, requests compulsory measures.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1809
tagDescription: Regarding petition of John Fulton for permission to erect a tannery at Cornwall.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: P. Selby to same. Advises him that the irregular patent for land, issued to Barbara Venice, is stopped in the Auditor's office.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: States names of certain half pay officers are on list of persons holding government offices.
Commission for Frederick Rolett as 2nd Lieut., Marine Dept., has been issued. Report on red cedar for ship building on Pelee Island given attention.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Petition of Patrick McMahon for assistance.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: Memorial from Wm. Jarvis and others for a distribution of fees due on completed leases.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Introduces Lt.-Col. Abercrombie, Lieut. McCoy, and Lieut. Hardinge, who are on a tour to Niagara.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Has forwarded his letter to Lord Castlereagh.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Transmits pay list and abstract of disbursements for Port George post. [Pay list not at this place].
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Regarding events in America. Reports destruction of French fleet in the Basque Roads.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Regarding Craig's orders on General Moreau's visit to Carleton Island.
Advising him of further Hallowell, depredations on timber.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Approves Beikie's absence on leave.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808
tagDescription: Inventory of government property in the secretary's office, by Wm. Jarvis.
Port Talbot, 8 June 1809, Explains difficulty in executing instructions for survey of Yarmouth township. (filed under June 8, 1809)
Explains difficulties in surveying the township of Yarmouth.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809

tagDescription: Has forwarded Mrs. Jane Paxton's petition to the Secretary of State.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES July to December 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: April 3, 1809, Quebec. Return of ordnance, etc., required for Marine service on Lake Erie.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
